cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 100 mi ESE of Jacksonville Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north then turning north-northeast, tracking parallel to the U.S. Southeast coast toward a landfall in northeastern South Carolina or southern North Carolina, then accelerating up the Mid-Atlantic coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the South Santee River SC – Surf City NC coast (around Wilmington, NC)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Watch Hill RI to Stonington ME including Martha’s Vineyard, Nantucket, and Block Island
weather_observation.warning_coast: Flagler/Volusia County Line FL northward to South Santee River SC (includes Jacksonville area)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire U.S. Atlantic coast from northeast Florida through New England within 5-day cone and wind-probability envelope
weather_observation.wind: Sustained tropical-storm-force winds possible with gusts 35–45 mph; 34 mph sustained and 40 mph gust already observed at Jacksonville Beach Pier
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft inundation possible at the immediate northeast Florida coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Additional 1–2 inches of rain possible; localized minor flooding in poor-drainage areas
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; very low tornado risk at the port
